subject: Business
title: Cloud Computing: From Owning to Renting
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cloud Computing: From Owning to Renting.

hook.text: In 2006, a startup needed $100,000 for servers. Today, they need a credit card and AWS. The barrier to entry vanished.

buildup.text: Cloud computing lets businesses rent computing power on-demand instead of buying and maintaining their own servers.

discovery.text: AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud rent servers by the second. Scale up for Black Friday, scale down on Tuesday.

twist.text: Amazon built AWS for internal needs. Then realized they could sell spare capacity.

climax.text: The cloud enabled Netflix, Spotify, Slack, and Zoom â€” companies that couldn't exist without elastic, pay-as-you-go.

punchline.text: Someone else's computer became the foundation of the modern economy.

quiz.question: Why was AWS originally created?
options: Amazon built it for internal needs and then sold spare capacity externally
It was designed from the start as a public service
A government grant funded its development
